abstract: The plan to purchase aQuantive for $6 billion, at an 85 percent premium, comes after acquisitions of other firms by WPP Group, Google and Yahoo.
snippet: The plan to purchase aQuantive for $6 billion, at an 85 percent premium, comes after acquisitions of other firms by WPP Group, Google and Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said today that it would buy the online advertising company aQuantive for $66.50 a share, or approximately $6 billion. It is Microsoft’s largest acquisition ever, and the latest in a flurry of deals for online advertising firms by big Internet and media companies.

headline.main: Microsoft to Buy Online Ad Company

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Eric Pfanner

abstract: Microsoft’s $6 billion acquisition of aQuantive signaled its struggle to build an Internet ad business on its own.
snippet: Microsoft’s $6 billion acquisition of aQuantive signaled its struggle to build an Internet ad business on its own.
lead_paragraph: It’s a good time to be an Internet advertising company.

headline.main: Internet Giants Vie to Snap Up Web Ad Firms
headline.print_headline: Internet Giants Vie to Snap Up Web Ad Firms
